result.execSummary:
The defendant John Eddie Farmer Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Conceal (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(d).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: EACH COUNT:  The court orders defendant to pay all applicable costs, fees, assessments and surcharges as a condition of Extended Supervision as imposed in 15CF3377 and failure to do so will result in entry of civil judgment.
Concurrent with: each count concurrent and concurrent to any other sentence.
Concurrent with: each count concurrent and concurrent to any other sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John Eddie Farmer Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Decision and Order DENYING Motion to Prohibit DOC Collections, signed and filed.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. John Siefert, Br. 47, for review. spc
Defendant's pro se motion to prohibit DOC deductions.
GUILTY PLEA & SENTENCING Transcript commencing 10-23-2015 received and filed.  Original transcript in case file 15CF3377 (15 Pages).  CH

Defendant John Eddie Farmer in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant John Eddie Farmer in custody.  Jay Randal Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  As to each count as charged:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
Sentencing proceeded. Statements by all parties.
  The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction, each count concurrent and concurrent to any other sentence.
  The court orders defendant to pay all applicable costs, fees, assessments and surcharges as a condition of Extended Supervision as imposed in 15CF3377 and failure to do so will result in entry of civil judgment.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant John Eddie Farmer not in court, in custody.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant John Eddie Farmer not in court, in custody.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 ON state's motion case adjourned.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 10-07-2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Violation Report received and filed.

Defendant John Eddie Farmer in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests an adjourned Plea and Sentencing date. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 47.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant John Eddie Farmer not in court, in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 07-24-2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ANY Pick n Save

Defendant John Eddie Farmer in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  Defendant John Eddie Farmer in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
